name: Technology Maturity Assessment
description: Comprehensive technology capacity assessment for Jewish nonprofit organizations

stakeholders.name: CEO/Executive Director
stakeholders.description: Senior leadership responsible for organizational strategy

stakeholders.name: Technology Lead
stakeholders.description: Person responsible for technology decisions and implementation

stakeholders.name: Program/Operations Staff
stakeholders.description: Staff members who use technology daily

domains.name: Infrastructure
domains.description: Technology foundation, security, and system management

domains.name: Business Systems
domains.description: Financial, HR, and operational management systems

domains.name: Data Management
domains.description: Data collection, analysis, and decision-making capabilities

domains.name: Program Technology
domains.description: Technology integration in program delivery and client services

domains.name: Technology Culture
domains.description: Leadership, strategy, and organizational readiness for technology

questions.text: How confident are you that new employees have the technology tools they need on day 1?
questions.description: This assesses the maturity of technology onboarding processes

options.label: Not confident - each new hire is handled ad-hoc
Somewhat confident - we have basic equipment but setup takes time
Moderately confident - standard equipment with some delays
Confident - streamlined process with minimal delays
Very confident - automated provisioning, everything ready day 1

questions.text: Do you have a documented, standardized technology onboarding process?

options.label: No documented process - everything is handled case-by-case
Basic documentation exists but not consistently followed
Standard process documented and mostly followed
Well-documented process with role-based provisioning
Fully automated onboarding with role-based access management

questions.text: How confident are you in your organization's ability to collect and analyze data for decision making?

options.label: Not confident - data collection is ad-hoc and unreliable
Somewhat confident - basic data collection but limited analysis
Moderately confident - regular data collection with some analysis
Confident - systematic data collection with regular analysis
Very confident - comprehensive data-driven decision making

questions.text: How would you rate your organization's data integration and management systems?

options.label: No integration - data exists in silos
Basic integration between some systems
Moderate integration with manual processes
Good integration with automated data flows
Excellent integration with real-time data synchronization

questions.text: How effectively do your business systems (HR, Finance, CRM) support your operations?

options.label: Not effective - systems create significant barriers
Somewhat effective - systems work but require workarounds
Moderately effective - systems meet basic needs
Effective - systems enhance productivity
Very effective - systems are strategic enablers

questions.text: How well does technology support your daily program delivery work?

options.label: Not well - technology hinders my work
Somewhat well - technology has limited usefulness
Moderately well - technology helps with basic tasks
Well - technology enhances my effectiveness
Very well - technology is essential to my success

questions.text: How would you rate your organization's leadership commitment to technology advancement?

options.label: Low commitment - technology is not a priority
Some commitment - technology is addressed when problems arise
Moderate commitment - technology is included in planning
High commitment - technology is a strategic priority
Very high commitment - technology drives organizational strategy

questions.text: How engaged is the board in technology governance and oversight?

options.label: Not engaged - board rarely discusses technology
Minimally engaged - board discusses technology when issues arise
Moderately engaged - board receives regular technology updates
Engaged - board actively participates in technology planning
Highly engaged - board provides strategic technology leadership

maturityLevels.name: Building
maturityLevels.description: Foundational technology needs, requires significant capacity building
recommendations: Focus on establishing basic technology infrastructure
Consider hiring technology consultant or part-time IT support

maturityLevels.name: Emerging
recommendations: Integrate systems for better data flow

maturityLevels.name: Thriving
maturityLevels.description: Advanced technology capabilities driving mission success
recommendations: Lead technology innovation in the sector
Share best practices with peer organizations
Mentor other organizations in technology adoption
